description: Highest common factor of successive highly composite numbers (1), A002182.
comments: Not the same as the first differences of A002182. The latter are given by A262501, which differs from this sequence for the first time at n=25, where A262501(25) = 17640, while here the 25th term a(26) is 2520. The sequences differ next time at positions n = 52, 53, 54, 64, 67, 82, 83, 84, 85, 86, 87, 88, 90, 91, 96, 100, 106, ... (when one-based indexing as in A262501 is used). - _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 24 2015
links: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000 (computed from the b-file of A002182 provided by _T. D. Noe_)
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 31 2000
extensions: Erroneous comment (wrong interpretation) removed by _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 25 2015
